But where did this meaning come from?
It looks like its made up of two words.
أَن لَّا تَعْبُدُوٓا۟ إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ ۖ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ أَلِيمٍۢ
أَن لَّا تَعْبُدُوٓا۟ إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ ۖ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ أَلِيمٍۢ
That you should worship none but Allah. I truly fear for you the torment of a painful Day.
That you should worship none but Allah. I truly fear for you the torment of a painful Day.
Focus on the highlighted words, have you seen them before?
Lets write it down once again.
The words تَعْبُدُوٓا۟ and مَعْبُودَ have the same root word which is عبد which means worship.
ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَٱلْحَقُّ وَأَنَّ مَا يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِۦ هُوَ ٱلْبَـٰطِلُ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلْعَلِىُّ ٱلْكَبِيرُ
ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَٱلْحَقُّ وَأَنَّ مَا يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِۦ هُوَ ٱلْبَـٰطِلُ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلْعَلِىُّ ٱلْكَبِيرُ
That is because Allah ˹alone˺ is the Truth and what they invoke besides Him is falsehood, and Allah ˹alone˺ is truly the Most High, All-Great.
That is because Allah ˹alone˺ is the Truth and what they invoke besides Him is falsehood, and Allah ˹alone˺ is truly the Most High, All-Great.
Allah is telling you that He is the Only True God Who should be worshipped.
All other Gods are False Gods that people falsely created for themselves.
Congratulations! Now you know why اِلهَ means مَعْبُودَ بِحَقٍّ !
A building cannot stand without all its pillars.
In the same way, your Tawheed cannot stand without all its Pillars.
The words of Tawheed have two pillars. And they come from the two parts of Kalima Tawheed.
There is no God Worthy of Worship

This pillar is called
اثبات
(Affirmation)

This pillar is called
نفى
(Negation)
And you need both these pillars for your Tawheed to stand.
Lets look at the meaning of each word in Kalima Tawheed
لاَ There is no
اِلهَ Deity Worthy of Worship
So, the translation of لاَ اِلهَ اِلاّ الله is not
The correct translation of لاَ اِلهَ اِلاّ الله is

There is no
God Worthy of Worship
Except Allah
But where did this meaning come from?
We will study it in the next lesson!

lessonAnimation.sectionTitle: Fearing someone other than Allah in a matter in which only Allah has the Power over
lessonAnimation.sectionDescription:
إِنَّمَا ذَٰلِكُمُ الشَّيْطَانُ يُخَوِّفُ أَوْلِيَاءَهُ فَلَا تَخَافُوهُمْ وَخَافُونِ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ 
That is only shaytan who frightens (you) of his supporters.  
So fear them not, but fear Me, if you are (indeed) believers. 

[Surat Aal-e-Imran: Ayah 175] 

The fear that Allah subhanahu wa Ta’la is talking about here is not the kind of fear that we naturally feel, like when we see a big spider. This is natural fear. The type of fear Allah Subhanahu wa Ta’la is talking about here is “When a person fears other than Allah in some matter in which only Allah has the Power over.” An example of this is in the battle of Uhud when the Muslims were preparing to fight the enemy, the hypocrites feared the opposition more than they feared Allah.

subSections.content: إِنَّمَا ذَٰلِكُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ يُخَوِّفُ أَوْلِيَآءَهُۥ فَلَا تَخَافُوهُمْ وَخَافُونِ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
That is only Satan who frightens [you] of his supporters. So fear them not, but fear Me, if you are [indeed] believers.
The fear that Allah subhanawhu wa Ta’la is talking about here is not the kind of fear that we naturally feel, like when we see a big spider. This is natural fear.
The type of fear Allah Subhanahu wa Ta’la is talking about here is
When a person fears something other than Allah in a matter in which only Allah has the Power over.
Let's understand this from the story that happened.
Allah revealed this Ayah during the time of the battle of Uhud. When about 700 Muslims stood against an opposition of 3000.
Someone from the hypocrites who feared the opposition more than he feared Allah came to the messenger of Allah Sallallahu Alayhi wa Sallam and said:

'Verily, the people have gathered against you, therefore, fear them.'
[Surat Ali 'Imran 3:173]
But the Prophet Mohammed Sallahu Alayhi wa Sallam replied:

حَسْبُنَا ٱللَّهُ وَنِعْمَ ٱلْوَكِيلُ 'Allah is Sufficient for us and He is the Best Disposer of affairs for us.'
[Surat Ali 'Imran 3:173]
This shows us that the Prophet Sallallahu Alayhi wa Sallam feared Allah and did not fear the opposition army because he knew that Only Allah has the Power
And the story ends with this beautiful Ayah from Allah:
فَٱنقَلَبُوا۟ بِنِعْمَةٍۢ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَفَضْلٍۢ لَّمْ يَمْسَسْهُمْ سُوٓءٌۭ وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ رِضْوَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو فَضْلٍ عَظِيمٍ
So they returned with Grace and Bounty from Allâh. No harm touched them; and they followed the good Pleasure of Allâh. And Allâh is the Owner of Great Bounty.
